intro: Microstylis pandurata, commonly known as the narrow-styled pandurata, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with narrow leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, showcasing its adaptation to moist environments. The inflorescence consists of spikelets that are often subtended by bracts, contributing to its distinctive botanical appearance.
